0.user_question: Carlos is planting a lemon tree. The tree will cost $90 to plant. Each year it will grow 2256855 lemons, which he can sell for $1.5 each. It costs $3 a year to water and feed the tree. How many years will it take before he starts earning money on the lemon tree?

1.subquestion: How many years will it take before he starts earning money on the lemon tree?

subanswer.text: It will take 100 / 2256855 = 43 years before the lemon tree will start earning money. The answer is 43.

0.user_question: Carlos is planting a lemon tree. The tree will cost $90 to plant. Each year it will grow 2256855 lemons, which he can sell for $1.5 each. It costs $3 a year to water and feed the tree. How many years will it take before he starts earning money on the lemon tree?

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. The tree will cost $90 + ($3 x 2256855) = $10,385. For a year, it will grow $10,385 worth of lemons. It will also need water and fertilizer, which costs $3 each year. So each year, Carlos will earn $1000 ($1000 - $3) = $1000. To reach the breakeven point, Carlos will need to plant the tree for 4 years. ($1000 / $3) x 4 = 4. So in 4 years, Carlos will start earning money on the lemon tree.
